title: Paul Salata
text:
Paul Thomas Salata (October 17, 1926 – October 16, 2021) was an American professional <a href="gridiron%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL), <a href="All-America%20Football%20Conference">All-America Football Conference</a> (AAFC) and <a href="West%20Division%20%28CFL%29">Western Interprovincial Football Union</a> (WIFU). He was born to a Serbian-born father and second generation Serbian-American mother. After his <a href="college%20football">college football</a> days at <a href="USC%20Trojans%20football">USC</a>, Salata played for the AAFC/NFL's <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a> (1949–1950) and the AAFC's <a href="Baltimore%20Colts%20%281947-1950%29">Baltimore Colts</a> (1950). After the Colts franchise folded in 1950 he was declared draft-eligible and was subsequently drafted in the tenth round of the <a href="1951%20NFL%20Draft">1951 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a>. He scored the 49ers final touchdown in the All-American Football Conference, as well as the team's first TD in NFL. He also played three final seasons in Canada; 1952 with the <a href="Calgary%20Stampeders">Calgary Stampeders</a>, where he was an all-star, and 1953 with the <a href="Ottawa%20Rough%20Riders">Ottawa Rough Riders</a>.
In later years, Salata became known for creating the <a href="Mr.%20Irrelevant">Mr. Irrelevant</a> Award in the <a href="NFL%20Draft">NFL Draft</a>, awarded annually to the last overall pick in the year's draft. After retiring from football, he joined his family's Southern California construction business. He has also acted in a number of Hollywood movies. He played Tony Minelli in "<a href="Angels%20in%20the%20Outfield%20%281951%20film%29">Angels in the Outfield</a>" (1951) and appeared, uncredited, in the 1953 film "<a href="Stalag%2017">Stalag 17</a>" as a prisoner.
Salata died on October 16, 2021, one day before his 95th birthday.
